tit.cmt: 一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 大織冠（だいしょくかん、だいしきかん）は、冠位十二階を改訂し、大化の改新で大化3年（647年）制定（施行は648年にされた）、冠位・官位制度の変遷冠位十三階で新たにもうけられた、冠位の最高位。
sen.e: Taishokkan (Holder of the Grand Crown) was the highest rank which was established in the Taika Reforms in 647 (enforced in 648) by revising Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank), and which was newly established in Hensen Kan I jusankai (thirteen grades of cap rank) of the cap rank and official rank system.

Taishokkan (Daishikikan) was the highest rank which was established in the Taika Reforms in 647 (enforced in 648) by revising the Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank), and which was newly established in the Kan I jusankai (thirteen grades of cap rank) of the cap rank and official rank system.
sen.cmt: Taishikikan を追加しました。官位制の表現にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: Taishokkan (Daishikikan) was the highest rank which was established in the Taika Reforms in 647 (enforced in 648) by revising the Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank), and which was newly established in the Kan I jusankai (thirteen grades of cap rank) of the cap rank and official rank system.

sen.j: 大化5年（649年）に改正された冠位十九階、天智天皇3年（664年）の冠位二十六階にも引き継がれている。
sen.e: It was also inherited to the Kan I jukyukai (nineteen grades of cap rank) revised in 649 and the Kan I nijurokkai (twenty-six grades of cap rank) in 664.
It was also inherited to the Kan I jukyukai (nineteen grades of cap rank) revised in 649 and the Kan I nijurokkai (twenty-six grades of cap rank) in 664.
It was also inherited to the Kan I jukyukai (nineteen grades of cap rank) revised in 649 and the Kan I nijurokkai (twenty-six grades of cap rank) in 664.

sen.j: 冠位十二階に組み込まれていなかった、大臣（おおおみ）が身につけていた紫冠が上から5,6番目に置かれ、さらにその上に置かれた冠位の為、朝廷に非常に大きな功績があった功臣のみに送られる冠位であった。
sen.e: Since murasaki no kouburi that was worn by Okami and was not included in Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank) was ranked the fifth or sixth from the top, Taishokkan was a higher cap rank than that, it was donated to only meritorious vassals who accomplished great achievements to the imperial court.

Taishokkan was bestowed to only meritorious vassals who accomplished great achievements to the Imperial Court since it was placed at a higher cap rank than Murasaki no koburi; Murasaki no koburi had been worn by Oomi (a highest officer in national politics of the Yamato dynasty) and had not been included in the Kan I junikai, but was then demoted to the fifth or sixth from the top.
sen.cmt: kouburi →koburi, Okami→ Oomi と修正しました。既出単語の補足を削除しました。Donate →bestowed としました。
sen.e: Taishokkan was bestowed to only meritorious vassals who accomplished great achievements to the Imperial Court since it was placed at a higher cap rank than Murasaki no koburi; Murasaki no koburi had been worn by Oomi (a highest officer in national politics of the Yamato dynasty) and had not been included in the Kan I junikai, but was then demoted to the fifth or sixth from the top.

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）の冠位四十八階制によって廃止。
sen.e: It was abolished when the 48 grades of cap rank was established in 685.
It was abolished when the Kan I yonjuhakkai (forty-eight grades of cap rank) was established in 685.
sen.cmt: 他と統一し、冠位四十八階 の読みを追加しました。
sen.e: It was abolished when the Kan I yonjuhakkai (forty-eight grades of cap rank) was established in 685.

sen.j: また、藤原鎌足の別名でもある。
sen.e: It was also used as another name of FUJIWARA no Kamatari.
It was also used as another name of FUJIWARA no Kamatari.
It was also used as another name of FUJIWARA no Kamatari.

sen.j: 天智天皇8年（669年）11月5日 (旧暦)に大織の冠位を貰ったためにこう呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was because he received Taishoku no kani (First Cap Rank) on November 5, 669 (the old calendar).
It was because he received Taishoku no kani (First Cap Rank) on December 6, 669.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。
sen.e: It was because he received Taishoku no kani (First Cap Rank) on December 6, 669.

sen.j: 記録上、諸臣の中で大織冠を貰ったのは鎌足だけの様である。
sen.e: Only Kamatari received Taishokkan among shoshin (retainers) on the record.
Only Kamatari received Taishokkan among retainers on the record.
sen.cmt: shoshin を削除し、retainer のみとしました。
sen.e: Only Kamatari received Taishokkan among retainers on the record.

sen.j: 他には、662年に百済王子、余豊璋に織冠を与えたと言う記録が見られるのみである。
sen.e: In addition, there was only one record that shokkan was donated to YO Hosho, a prince of Paekche, in 662.
sen.cmt: 余豊璋はYO Hoshoとしました。
sen.e: In addition, there was only one record that shokkan was donated to YO Hosho, a prince of Paekche, in 662.
